newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan gold rates seen stable on low demand.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan gold rates seen stable on low demand.

text.p: Pakistan gold rates are likely to remain steady this week on low demand due to political uncertainty, dealers said on Monday.
"Investors in gold have gone to the sidelines because of the poor economic outlook, shortage of funds and political uncertainty," said dealer Saeed Qureshi.

Gold traders were themselves buying dollars, partly because of fears of another devaluation of the rupee, though there has been no official indication that this is imminent. "There is no charm in the gold trade now," one dealer said.
Silver rates were likely to remain steady in the absence of big buyers due to political jitters, the dealer said.
Gold rate for 24 carat in Karachi per 10 grammes
Silver rate in Karachi per 1,000 grammes
